@DownTYU: Ultimately, it comes down to bytes per pixels. As resizer I use 64-tap spline - better one is not invented and probably wont be - even Avisynth developers still ask around for someone who can explain how it works. Details are not lost - if bytes per pixels value is high enough (they cannot go anywhere, LOL) - but - bigger frame-sizes better correspond with someone's playback system and ultimately - vision of the person who watch.

On less than year old prevalent displays (both TV and comp. monitor) with sizes up to 19 inches, there is no difference between two frame-sizes IF the same value for bytes per pixels is used in encoding.

Situation has changed dramatically last 14 months, when LCD displays achieved massive production and affordable pricing.

Are they better? Good? They are more practical, smaller, consume less power - but better in terms of video quality, even LED backlighted ones? Answer is simple No, not yet. It may hurt people, but that is the truth.

You got 40" LCD not long ago and I have Toshiba 42" most expensive LCD money can buy ten feet away (in living room, where I doesn't go at all). As computer displays I run 23.5" LED LCD from LG and Samsung 17" CRT and I can switch them through Belkin switch). I MUST have them both, to verify encodes in different "environments" and I can say and repeat again - LCD suck balls - it is big, thin, nice looking - but that's it. 

Point being - encodes look better on CRT one, period. All troubles low-bit-rate encodes have, by nature - are exaggerated by technological immaturity of LCD. Banding, pixelazations  in flat areas, et.c...

@DownTYU:

"I've been thinking of caching twenty forty encodes and provide direct download links when needed."

Direct download links are out of the question. Only possibility I even encouraged is to make torrents and use PUBLIC tracker site for uploading.

I wont become BoB or million of so called "uploaders" to file-hosting services (Wupload, Filesonic, Fileserve and many many others) because they pay to uploaders 25 - 50 dollars per 1000 downloads.

I could be very very rich man by now - but I would not sell "my soul to devil".

Public tracker sites  and torrents are true last standing bastion of  true file sharing.

I see every day on Forums how sheep keep saying "Thanks for sharing" to uploaders to RapidShare or wherever... and it makes me sick...
Sharing? No - these guys upload Scene or P2P group's encodes and MAKE money - they provide service, a profitable one. Out there are so called "uploaders" who  proudly speak about up to 1700 USD profit per month. Yes, they have expenses - but - they are covered,  at the end.

I ask for respect only. And less harsh approach. I really do best I can, whoever thinks otherwise - can go someplace else and at least, leave me alone with my friends.
I don't need popularity, I ask for respect.
